item.title: Personal life is a playground for solving optimization problems
item.description: It is uncommon to discuss optimization in terms of our daily lives; instead, it is typically reserved for contexts involving large-scale operations, supply chains, technology, or business procedures.
item.author: (Kelvin Paschal Idanwekhai)

item.title: Why can’t I focus?
item.description: Being able to focus, to do deep, meaningful work is a key skill for engineering leaders. Yet, oftentimes it seems hard to maintain a sustained high concentration level. I thought about my experiences when I struggled with this, and listed a few reasons I might have had trouble maintaining focus.

item.title: The WAF Swiss-Knife – Pomba Labs
item.description: This blogpost showcases some not-so-commonly-advertised benefits and features that modern WAFs have, and how they can be used in an average company to gain benefits ranging from technical to political. It also provides some tips and tricks that I would have liked to know a few years ago.

item.title: The Platonic Representation Hypothesis
item.description: Conventionally, different AI systems represent the world in different ways. A vision system might represent shapes and colors, a language model might focus on syntax and semantics. However, in recent years, the architectures and objectives for modeling images and text, and many other signals, are becoming remarkably alike. Are the internal representations in these systems also converging?

item.title: What’s Up with Mastodon and “Referer” Headers?
item.description: One thing that’s helped me keep up with blogging this month is seeing my web analytics numbers go up. I maybe check my analytics too often, but at least it’s a good motivator to be productive.

item.description: The European Union’s new Digital Markets Act (DMA) is a complex, many-legged beast, but at root, it is a regulation that aims to make it easier for the public to control the technology they use and rely on. One DMA rule forces the powerful “gatekeeper” tech companies to allow third-party app stores...
